headline: Match Play Live: A day of elimination and comebacks
author: The Associated Press
sentences:
AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — The Latest on the Dell Technologies Match Play (all times local):
6:30 p.m.
As the second day of the Dell Technologies Match Play heads for a conclusion, already 14 of the 32 matches have gone the distance and six winners staged back-nine comebacks to win.

5:45 p.m.
Paul Casey, of England, hits from the sixth tee during the final round of play in The Players Championship golf tournament Monday, March 14, 2022, in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla.

Watson was 1 down to Webb Simpson with two holes left when he made a 35-foot birdie putt on the 17th to square the match, and Simpson bogeyed the final hole to lose.
Casey was all square through two holes in the opening session of round-robin play on Wednesday when he suffered back spasms and conceded the match to Corey Conners.
There also is only one meaningless match between 0-2 records — Casey against Louis Oosthuizen — and that won’t be played because Casey withdrew from the tournament.

Tony Finau was 2 up with four holes to play when Kanaya chipped in on the 15th, birdied the 16th and made a tough birdie putt on the 17th to take the lead.
Friday is the final session of round-robin, and only one group will feature an undefeated pairing: Corey Conners of Canada against Alex Noren of Sweden.

9:45 a.m.
Paul Casey’s warmup lasted only a few minutes before he realized his back was not good enough to play in the Dell Technologies Match Play.

2:15 p.m.
Lucas Herbert, Takumi Kanaya and Bubba Watson have staged rallies on the back nine to pick up wins in the Dell Technologies Match Play.
The others to be eliminated so far are Paul Casey, Louis Oosthuizen, Robert MacIntyre, Tom Hoge, Keith Mitchell and Christiaan Bezuidenhout.
Even though he rallied to halve his match against Adam Scott, it was his 14th consecutive match without winning in this tournament.

He warmed up Thursday morning and barely got through his wedges when he realized he couldn’t go and forfeited to Alex Noren.
The old boys from Blighty will be battling each other with a chance to win their group in the Dell Technologies Match Play.
But he won the 13th with a superb chip behind the green and the 15th with a strong fairway bunker shot that set up birdie.

He was 3 down to British Open champion Collin Morikawa when the Spaniard won the next three holes with birdies.
They were all square on the 18th when Herbert laid back off the tee and hit his approach to 8 feet for birdie.
Among the top seeds from each group already eliminated are Patrick Cantlay, Oosthuizen, Bryson DeChambeau.
Lee Westwood lost a lead to Bryson DeChambeau and then beat him on the 18th to raise his record to 1-1-0.

There are a number of Friday matches each year between players who have been eliminated.

3 p.m.
Paul Casey’s lost week at the Dell Technologies Match Play is officially over.
Finau missed an 8-foot birdie putt on the final hole that would have earned a halve.
Herbert was 2 down and hitting it everywhere off the tee against Xander Schauffele.
